name: Hotel Triton - a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.text: I'd heard that the Triton was an amazing experience, not to be missed since my colleagues know I'm fed up with the run-of-the-mill Hilton/Marriott/Sheratons of business travel. But it didn't meet my expectations, certainly not for the rate of $250ish a night. It is cramped and claustrophobic, the room and bathroom fittings aren't great, there was an odd smell in the room, the wireless internet had no coverage in the room, and the decor (whilst immaculate) was very full-on. I'd pay $160 for it, but a bit of hippyish goodwill doesn't make up the remaining $90 a night.
reviews.title: quirky but disappointing
Triton Rocks!
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Triton for a week-end in January 2005. We are fifty something and loved the Triton. It was cheap and very comfortable. The beds were great, the shower was great. The rooms were uniquely, coolly and tastefully decorated. The staff was friendly. The location, at the gates to Chinatown, was excellent. Even the elevators were cool. The hotel has recently been renovated and it shows.

Due to a convention in town, I was forced to book this hotel for two nights on a business trip. It was a mistake. I booked the so-called "zen den", which was a tiny room but liveable with a nice bathroom area and brightly colored walls. The main problem was that the room faced Bush Street, which runs one way to the financial district. For most of the night, you're treated to the noise of speeding cars, loud motorcycles, people chatting as they walk past, garbage trucks, and, at 3 a.m., someone wandering around playing the flute. Needless to say, sleeping was difficult, if not impossible, under these circumstances.
reviews.title: Zen Den Hell
Overprized
reviews.text: The hotel offered to swith me to a room on the other side but noted that the garbage trucks operate over on that side. You could hear them pretty well from my side so it must have been unbearable on that side of the building.

In any case, if you're traveling on business and require a quiet hotel, avoid this one. If you don't, you risk having your own zen-like experience trying to get through the work day in a sleep-deprived haze.
reviews.title: What a great lil' find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Triton for 4 nights recently and booked through Hotwire for a competitive rate. I expected to be treated to a small room and so-so service based on various reviews (guidebooks, websites, etc). My brother stayed here and proclaimed the rooms to be tiny. We received a room on the Eco floor (7th floor) facing away from the main streets. The room was small, but not uncomfortable in my or my husband's opinion. The bathroom had been renovated with a granite countertop and tiled showerstall. I found our room to be exceptionally peaceful and quiet, perhaps because we were on the top floor. My only problem with the Eco floor was that the shower gel/shampoo/(thin & runny) conditioner was in a dispenser on the wall, but not filled with Aveda products (the normal amenities in a Kimpton hotel). The hotel remedied that when I requested for them. The hotel was a good value- great location (next to Chinatown, steps from shops, close to the BART/MUNI/cable cars), nice perks such as morning coffe & tea, newspapers, fresh apples, cookies. They willingly credited my Kimpton rewards even though I booked through Hotwire. The only service flaw I encountered was at check out, with the less-than-friendly sole front desk person was involved with her personal telephone conversation. I'd probably stay here again and request the 7th floor and steer clear of the rooms facing the elevators which blare music.
reviews.title: Location, location!
Nice hotel, but read on
reviews.text: I've combed San Francisco for hotels in the under -$150/night range, and the Triton is my favorite -- location, cleanliness, friendly and helpful staff, and decor are all above average. In my most recent stay, though, I had a room they call a "Zen den," facing out on an alley along the hotel's south side. At around 2:00 am, I was awakened by loud clanging metal and hydraulic whooshing sounds. These continued, on and off, for well over an hour. Eventually I looked out of the window and saw an enormous garbage truck pulling out of the alley. As I passed the alley in the morning, I counted eighteen dumpsters! I considered asking for another room, but figured this was likely only a once or twice per week occurrence. But the same thing happened the next night. I got up at 4:00 am and asked for another room, and was accommodated without fuss, and it was quiet. So keep that in mind. (Also, be aware that the "Zen den" rooms are quite small, with a double bed along one wall and very little open floor space. The second one they gave me had a stall shower that required crouching to get under the shower stream.)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A really felt like I was in SF, staying at an eco-friendly hotel with funky decor and Greatful Dead inspired themes. Staff was super friendly and suggested some great eats nearby.
reviews.title: Liked the Jerry Garcia Suite

reviews.text: The rooms are well above average, the restrauant excellant, however the Hotel Staff is the best out there.. For a great time, where you don't feel like a stranger, the Triton is AAA+ Close to everthing in San Fran...If you stay you won't be Sorry!
reviews.title: It's the Staff People

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The location is great - very central. The hotel is unique and we found it to be good value. I was a bit surprised at how small our room and bathroom were, but it wasn't a problem since we were hardly there. The front desk people were very helpful. We would probably stay there again.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: Both my husband and I travel extensively for business and have those weird traveller needs. This stay was business for my husband, but pleasure for me, so this reveiw takes both perspectives into account. We are in our mid-thirties, used to live in SF, and like staying at nice hotels, but not stuffy hotels - so we chose the Triton over the W or the Clift. As previous locals, we would have stayed in another neighborhood if it weren't for the conference (staying downtown can be intense), but since we were here for business for him - it worked out great.
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings

reviews.text: Positives:
reviews.title: Overpriced tiny room
If you want to sleep don't stay at the Triton
reviews.text: -The Triton hit our criteria of staying where other folks our age stay, not being stuffy, and being within walking location to transit (great bonus for heading out to dinner in other neighborhoods) and the convention at the Moscone Center - perfect.

reviews.title: Nice staff, .... but!
reviews.text: -Our room was between a maid's closet and a stairway, so was very quiet. We were here over a weekend and during the week and I never heard anyone partying or being loud.

reviews.title: loved the Jerry Garcia suite
reviews.text: -FREE Coffee in the morning in the lobby was awesome. When you travel a lot it is a pain to have to shower and run down the street for coffee every morning for a week. It was so nice to bop down to the lobby to get some free organic coffee that tasted pretty good.

Just returned from a two-night stay at the Triton, and I have to say my experience was in contrast to that of some of the other reviewers who felt there was a lack of restaurants in the neighborhood or that the staff wasn't helpful enough. We received excellent recommendations for dining in the neighborhood (Taylor St., Ryoko and Le Colonial) both nights of our stay from helpful concierge, Nick. Add to that a perfect location -- practically in Chinatown, right next to Union Square, and convenient to the waterfront--and a fun decor. It's true that some facilities could use better upkeep (e.g., plumbing), but for the price, I would go back to Triton again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Perfect Location...Fun Hotel

reviews.text: Traveling in San Francisco for a conference and all the big named hotels were sold out when I came acrosss this wonderfully decorative place as an alternative. The location was great...being right across from the gates of China town and the staff were friendly. I was really pleased to see that the hotel was also environmentally friendly. The decor made you feel like you were living it up in San Francisco with a bit of chic sophistication. The rooms were small but I thought the were adequete if you are rooming with someone you know fairly well. The daily fresh baked cookies in the lobby were also an added plus. I was quite surprised at how much I enjoyed this whimsical little place.
reviews.title: A nice surprise...
Good location, reasonable accomodation
reviews.text: My husband and I were very excited about staying at this hotel at the beginning of our honeymoon as it seemed a bit different from the norm. We stayed in a number of different hotels during our trip and this was our least favourite as it was just a little bit tired.

The location of this hotel is good, although we found that there are only a couple of decent restaurants in close proximity to the hotel. The lobby was nice but we started to see tired decor on stepping out of the lift on our floor. There had been a leak outside of one of the rooms and the wallpaper was all peeling off, with plaster and paper lying on the carpet. Our room was not very spacious but big enough. It was in need of some upgrading though in order to make it the trendy boutique hotel it is advertised as. The bed however was very comfortable and the bathroom facilities were fine, if a bit cramped.
reviews.title: former Triton fan disappointed

reviews.text: We found the reception staff helpful, but housekeeping don't give you much warning before bursting in so make sure to use your lock or do not disturb if you want to avoid that!!
reviews.title: Well located Kimpton outlet

reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel before and had a mostly good experience, however, on a recent trip our vehicle was damaged by the hotel and/or their valet service. The manager and the valet admitted the damage and accepted responsibility -- that is until we checked out and left. I guess they were just telling us what we wanted to hear. Once we returned home, we received a hostile letter from the valet company refusing to accept responsibility. We tried calling the hotel management to remind them that they had accepted responsibility but they never once returned a phone call or email. It's bad enough that they damaged our car, but it took them forever to bring the car around in the morning causing us to be late for an important meeting with an investor. Why the hotel management would behave this way and mistreat its customers is a mystery to us. Buyer beware!!
reviews.title: bad experience

reviews.text: I stayed here two nights on a business trip after recommendation from a colleague who is a regular at Triton. I thought it was a really cool hotel with different and colourful touches, such as the "red light disco elevator". The room was small but homey and comfortable. There was a small stereo with CD music. Good bathroom.
reviews.title: Cool and different

reviews.text: There was a fortune telling lady in the reception area one of the evenings, a bit odd. She had her own table there for clients.
reviews.title: Hotel Triton gets an A+

reviews.text: You can’t beat this location, right at the Chinatown gate on Grant Ave, five minute walk to Union Square, Market Street, cable car stop, and BART station. I took BART from the airport to Montgomery station and easily walked to the hotel. Even though I knew nothing about SF, I had no difficulty finding the hotel. SF’s mostly square-grid street layout makes it easy.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Good Location

reviews.text: All of the staff were unfailingly polite, friendly, and enthusiastic. At check-in, I mentioned that this was my first visit to San Francisco, and the front desk clerk gave me a map brochure, oriented me with the area, and made suggestions for dining and sightseeing options based on my interests.
reviews.title: very convenient, comfortable

reviews.text: Music plays in the lobby, but it was inaudible in my 2 nd floor room. At the intersection outside my window, the crosswalk has a textured pavement, so there was a rough grinding noise every time a car went by, but the air conditioner on low speed provided enough white noise to mask the traffic noise. The weather was cool and did not require AC, so I ran it on fan-only, to circulate in some outside air.
reviews.title: Good location, nice rooms - a bit small

reviews.text: Great location being close to excellent shopping and a good start point for most tourist destinations but we found The Triton very disappointing. The staff were friendly and competent but the rooms were small, badly decorated (we thought ours had been decorated by a four year old!) and overpriced. On the whole we felt the hotel was quite shabby and did not feel any formal design input had been put into the rooms or corridors but a mish-mash of ebay and garage sale junk thrown together with little care for the overall aesthetics. I will say that the reception area furnishings and decor do work better than the corridors and rooms but hope some day soon they will choose to lose the blue and red lights in the lift interiors (!)
reviews.title: Bad hotel, great location
Am I missing something???
reviews.text: Cafe de la Presse was closed (as has been since at least my last trip in April) which was a real blow as I've eaten there many times and really enjoyed it.

reviews.title: Too tiny, too funky
reviews.text: Shame there was a charge for the Tarot readings during the wine event and that the wine I endured was of such poor quality. The whole idea could have been a fun talking point and good opportunity to socialise.

Booked this through hotwire at $125 a night. The staff were very friendly, though inexperienced (our first room had other guests luggage in it, the second room we opened to guests being in the room, the third room was fine). This hotel was very dated and shabby, and the room was uncomfortably tiny. Also, the Cafe De Presse was being renovated RIGHT BELOW US so all day from 8 in the morning until 6 at night all we heard was banging and loud construction noise (even on the weekend!). PArking was a rip off at $37 plus tax, and it took nearly 20 minutes for the valet to get our car once we were ready to check out. Would not stay here again at all!!!
reviews.title: Great concept, decor but noisy, weird ick smell

reviews.text: Wierd funky hotel. Tiny rooms, flashy furniture. Its trying to be funky in a cool way, but definitely not my style. Definitely not a place for business travelers. Location isn't bad - bang in front of China Town gate. If you like blue and red velvet furniture in a cramped up room, then go for it!
reviews.title: This place is the real deal. Great Hotel. Great Location.
Enjoyed Our Stay
reviews.text: This was my third stay at the Hotel Triton in the last 6 or so years. As such, this review won’t be as detailed.

In sum, the Triton is a perfect location for exploring the city. It’s adjacent to Chinatown, a few short blocks to the square and shopping, and close to all sources of transportation to easily get elsewhere in the city.
reviews.title: Nice, but small

reviews.text: Rooms are small but comfortable and more than adequate. Beds are fantastic! If noise is an issue, then request an inside room. The view is bland (faces an interior “courtyard”) but you’ll never hear a sound from the outside.
reviews.title: Best night in SFO

likes.disliked: — Can't come up with a thing!

reviews.text: All in all, staff were very friendly and helpful—which has always been the norm for this and other Kimpton properties. I had one interaction, however, that was mind-blowingly rude. I had gone downstairs for the evening wine hour. Staff typically pour the beverages (and, in fact, make a point of doing so to prevent customer abuse of the goodies), so I approached the bar and waited for a staff member. She was chatting with friends nearby and looked at me no fewer than three times and looked away each time. Another staff member had been outside assisting another customer and ran to the bar the moment he saw me. He apologized for her not being at her post. I could care less if she was not at her post when I approached, but her rudeness in blatantly ignoring me was over the top. This behavior was well below the usual standards of Kimpton staff.
reviews.title: Triton is tops

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice boutique-type hotel across the street from Chinatown entry. Hotel was tastefully decorated . The room was small but adequate for our trip. The parking was $38.00/day! Hotel allows pets. For $80, I preferred staying at the Nob HIll Motor Inn which was more central and had FREE parking!
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel -Great Location, Staff, Rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love boutique hotels until we stayed at the Triton. The Triton is not a boutique but rather a budget hotel. The room was small (tiny) and the bathroom had no space for our toiletries. The room needed to be refurbished and because of this appeared unkept. We had a view of an alley. We paid $181 a night with taxes. We heard from a friend who lives in San Francisco that the going rate for a room at the Triton isbetween $80-$90 a night and that would be an appropriate price for this property.The hotel advertised Frete sheets and we had one on the bed. They advertised Aveda products and we got one very small bar of soap for two people. I encouraged another couple to stay at the Triton and they left the next day. They found a rather elegant room a few blocks away for the same price. We stayed because we did not want the hassle of moving for a short Labor Day weekend trip. I wrote the hotel with these observations and to date have received no response. I read the Trip Advisor before booking and since the reviews were so mixed i decided to give it a try. Big Mistake on my part.
reviews.title: Never again.
I enjoyed my stay and the hotel, but some of the staff do have an attitude.
reviews.text: I got a really good deal thru priceline ($80 a night) and my request for a quiet room was honored. I was very glad to get a quiet room in this part of SF. This was my first trip to SF and I think this hotel spoke to the uniqueness of the city. I liked the aquatic theme they had going on the lobby. The room worked just fine for me. It looked and smelled clean and I slept well. I can see how some people would find it tacky. I would never decorate my own place with a zebra-striped headboard, but it was fine for a few days in my room. I can also see how more than 1 person in my room could become uncomfortable. I liked the eco-friendly touches in the bathroom (i.e. instead of bottles of shampoo and conditioner, they had a wall-mounted dispenser). I liked the Aveda products they had on the counter too. My favorite part of the hotel was probably the elevator lighting (pink and blue instead of flourescent) which, IMO, made being in the elevator fun and more relaxing.

I didn't use valet because I just garaged my car most of the time I was there. I wanted to use public transport and experience the trolley. I found it very easy to find parking in lots nearby a block or two away that were cheaper. Had I wanted to go in and out, though I have no idea if this would've still been cheaper. There places to eat close by (i.e. a Starbucks across the street), so food was easy for me to get.
reviews.title: Colorful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cons were most of the people who worked there. Where the courtesey they pay you to have in hospitality? Where's your SF pride? Such a great city. You have so much to be proud of! Not the friendliest staff or the most helpful. I think I met one nice person behind the counter. They put cookies out in the afternoon and they'd good.
reviews.title: Met Our Expectations

likes.disliked: — $37 charge for valet parking with a 20 minute wait for your car...but I understand that's pretty standard there.

reviews.text: I probably wouldn't return to this hotel unless they have a major customer service overhaul and mainly b/c I didn't prefer the union square/chinatown area. I definitely wouldn't pay full price for it. But it was a unique experience for my first visit and convenient to transportation, union square and Chinatown.
reviews.title: Will not stay again

likes.disliked: — I swear I got bed bug bites; room size & location

reviews.text: I stayed at the Triton for 4 nights, and there are some really great things about the hotel but also some that make it a bit less than great.
reviews.title: Mixed experience at the Triton

likes.disliked: — Justin Timberlake playing in the elevator!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First up, if you are staying there, make sure you ask for a quiet room away from the garbage trucks. On my first night I was awakened at 3am by horrendous noise. Garbage collection lasts about 30 minutes, and it was hard to get back to sleep afterwards. When I spoke to the front desk about it, just wondering what the noise had been, they immediately moved me to another room, overlooking Bush St and much quieter (there were no noise problems on any other night I was there). They did concede that the garbage collection noise is a major and ongoing problem in the hotel.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Triton!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room I was moved to was smaller than the first one, but it was generally fine. It was a 'Zen Den', which is one of the smaller categories of room, and there really is no spare space at all, but that wasn't a huge problem. If you want to do yoga in your room or anything, there's no space! It was so small the bathroom didn't even have a bath tub - something they didn't tell me at check in.
reviews.title: Cool, trendy, great location

reviews.text: Nice touches in the room: an iPod player. Fantastic to be able to hear my own music in the hotel room.
reviews.title: San Francisco Boutique Hotel

reviews.text: Huge flat screen TV - but I didn't ever use it.
reviews.title: A fun favorite
Wouldn't stay at this place if you paid me
reviews.text: Overall we thought that you could find a better hotel for the money but this one would do fine for a central location for a few nights.
Hotel Triton has been one of my favorite San Francisco hotels – but I was very disappointed during a recent visit.
reviews.title: Solid Boutique Hotel

reviews.text: Staff: Mostly friendly and helpful, but got some attitude on questions about our room.
reviews.title: Great Hotel -- Pet Friendly -- Fab Location

reviews.text: General Feel: Did not like this hotel. Really funky and just not our style. Some people call it "fun" - we called it weird and borderline tacky.
reviews.title: Small and Lousy

reviews.text: Experience: It's a Kimpton property so expected much more than what we got. This was a work related trip w/ spouse and our first night, we were given a double room, right across from the elevator door and it was clear someone had been smoking in the room previously despite their non-smoking policy. The room was also tiny. The remaining nights were were moved to a King room which was still small but a little better for 2 people.
reviews.title: Smaller rooms, good service, great location

reviews.text: The room service option was a French restaurant next door and the menu was very limited in terms of options and types of options. There were some nice perks, free wine/beer in lobby from 5-6pm, coffee in the AM, cookies in the afternoon. But none of those things made the room experience any better and we were there for 4 days.
reviews.title: Pretty good

reviews.text: This hotel is absolutely wonderful! I loved the different look of the hotel. Its unique look was a nice change because staring at white walls with cheesy paintings, like every other hotel, can get boring. It's in an excellent location and it's just a few blocks from a major MUNI station. The employees were incredibly helpful and super nice. They offer a complimentary wine and beer hour at 5 pm, which is something you don't see at most hotels. The restaurant next door (Cafe de la Presse) does Triton's room service and it's extremely tasty! I would highly recommend staying at this hotel. I'm definitely going to stay at the Triton whenever I travel to San Francisco.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 4 days at the Triton Hotel and enjoyed our stay very much.The hotel has many unusual features compared to other hotels we have stayed with such as the "wine hour" and the decor.If we had anything to complain about it would have to be the garbage trucks every night at all hours of the night.I am not faulting the hotel as we are sure they have little or no control over this matter.Hotel staff was wonderful.We received help from Tim,Anthony,Melissa and Tommy and they all were very pleasant.
reviews.title: Nice but different experience

reviews.text: I named my price from priceline.com and received the Hotel Triton as one of my options. The logo looked vaguely familiar but I decided to go with my gut instinct and book the stay.
reviews.title: Best hotel stay ever!

reviews.text: It turned out to be one of THE BEST hotel stays I've had ever. Not only are the celebrity suites fun and kitchy :), the service from everyone on staff was superb! The concierge desk recommended great restaurants and places to visit, helped me when we were lost in the city, not to mention everyone was extremely personable and friendly. The complimentary delicious cookies and "cocktail hour" each day made each day A LOT brighter as well.
reviews.title: tack o rama

likes.disliked: — it is worn out/tacky needs to be renovated, some service issues

reviews.text: The location was a great central location for everything we wanted to do in San Francisco. I won't stay anywhere else when I return to the city.
reviews.title: Fun & Funky!

reviews.text: I booked at the last minute through Priceline and paid $75 per night (versus their standard rate of $200 per night). The hotel is about 5 minutes walk from Union Square and Market Street and also about the same distance from the Montgomery Street BART station. It was about ten minutes to the Ferry building/Embarcadero and also 10-15 minutes through Chinatown to North Beach and the Italian restaurants.
reviews.title: Great hotel in an excellent location
Shortest stay ever! But liked every minute.
reviews.text: Having booked on Priceline for such a low amount I wasn't expectlng much, but was given an excellent room on the 6th floor. I didn't have any problem with street noise as mentioned in earlier posts. The room was small, with a queen bed and not a lot of room around, but it was more than enough for me. The bathroom was equally cozy, with just a shower although it was well-kept and clean, with Aveda shampoo and lotions too. The sink was in the bathroom; other posts suggest that in some rooms the sink is outside of the bathroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was well-furnished and clean although I think if they replaced the large cathode ray television with an LCD screen it could then be wall-mounted and the hotel could do away with the large television-and-minibar-containing cupboard, which dominates the small room. Other highlights include a zebra-striped bathrobe (the black stripes on mine were purple, presumably as a result of bleaching while washing), an iPod docking station, reliable WiFi, clean, comfortable white bedding and also the wine/beer hour from 5-6pm. This was really nice to take a couple of beers up to the room after spending the day walking around San Francisco.
reviews.title: Rainy & Windy outside, warm & toasty inside

reviews.text: I had breakfast at the adjacent Cafe de la Presse which attempts to recreate the ambiance and service of a Parisian cafe, with prices to match.
reviews.title: What an Awesome Way to Ring in the New Year!!!

likes.liked: — The artistic decor, and that it's an eco-friendly hotel

reviews.text: I think the rack rate charged is too much for this hotel, but if I were to be assigned it again through Priceline or Hotwire then I'd be more than happy.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, night-time street noise pretty intense

reviews.text: All would have been forgiven if not for the hallway brawl that awoke me at 5:15 am. After calling the front desk twice, and listening clearly to a brutal fight in the hall and the room across from me I finally decided to call 911. I was afraid to go into the hall, but from the sound of it, I think another guest finally did go into the hall to help.
reviews.title: Friendly Hotel in a great Location

reviews.text: When I finally did venture into the hall there was broken glass and other debris. I thought I would receive at least a simple apology from someone at the desk. All I received was my bill. Even the hallway wasn't promptly cleaned up.
reviews.title: Cafe being renovated

reviews.text: I've never had to call 911 at any hotel. Even understanding if an unusual incident would happen, no one said anything, and yet 2 SF patrol cars were needed for this incident.
reviews.title: Hotel Triton! Excellent Location, Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location wise, this hotel rated high being opposite the gates of China Town. It is also close to a number of eating places and shops. It was also very cool to have the Chinatown gates as the view from our hotel room.
reviews.title: Hoped for more

reviews.text: Unfortunately we were disappointed by our hotel room which was very small and the bed was simply not big enough for 2 people (we are not big people). Our room looked very weathered and the blinds meant light crept in during the night very easily. Bathroom was okay and closet space was adequate. Had the bed been bigger, I would have marked the score higher but as we were on our honeymoon, this was disappointing. Bizarrely our television kept switching itself on around 11pm every night.
reviews.title: Most fantastic hotel during our holiday in Califonia.

reviews.text: Coffee in the morning was very good as well as was the gratitude expressed by the cleaner for leaving them a couple of dollars as a tip. You don't often get that in hotels.
reviews.title: Love it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a sidenote, the elevators were very funky.
reviews.title: Funky hotel in great location, but a touch noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To be fair, all the hotels that my daugther & myself stayed during our 20 days holiday in LA, LV, G.Canyon, Yosemite and San Francisco were good. But the best hotel we stayed was in Triton, San Francisco. The moment when we arrived, there was this "ambassdor dog, Romeo" that greeted us and lead us the way in. Never seen this before; this is fantastic! All the staff were also very friendly and helpful. They did their best as service providers. Truely, this is a great hotel to stay; it was like home to us.
reviews.title: Pretty horrible hotel

reviews.text: I love Kimptons, although the Hotel Triton, like many of their hotels, has very little drawer space. The front desk staff was very friendly, check in was easy, and during a busy time in San Francisco, the rate was quite good, BUT, the room was tiny, there was no full length mirror, and no in room safe (a necessity in an urban location). The room was clean, but the plumbing is old, and there is poor water pressure in the shower. I travelled without my husband, luckily, because he would have bee complaining from day one.
reviews.title: A SMALL disappointment!

reviews.text: One very good thing: the wine was great!
reviews.title: Hidden gem, perfect location!
Excellent location and pleasant staff
reviews.text: Love this hotel, the staff were very helpful and everything we needed was within walking distance. The room was very clean and comfortable! We will definitely stay here again the next time we visit.

We had a great stay at this hotel - very centrally located next to Chinatown with easy access to local transport. The room was attractively decorated in an individual style, with the words from a Beat novel on the wall! The staff were all extremely pleasant and provided lots of helpful information. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in a quirky boutique hotel in central San Francisco.
reviews.title: Great hotel , Great Staff , Great location!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Triton after finding place in it by fluke a week before WWDC.
reviews.title: Eye-popping decor, great but noisy location on edge of Chinatown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A memorable experience - can't say that about most hotel stays. So convenient to everything; extraordinary staff, always ready and wanting to be helpful; comfortable in every way. Would that all hotels would be so accommodating!
reviews.title: Near perfect
Too small, too cool
reviews.text: Went for our anniversary and was sorely disappointed. The location is great right across from the gates of Chinatown and right down the street from Union Square, so shopping is super easy. However... the staff is just too snooty for words! What the heck? I wonder if we were too old to be considered cool or hip here? Not sure what the problem was but, didn't find them helpful at all. The room was really unique, zebra stripes etc. and tiny. Again, maybe just to hip for us 35+ folks?
My partner and I stayed in this hotel for three nights and every single one of the staff were lovely and friendly all the time - a rarity these days!!
reviews.title: Ideal location & brilliant staff!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms weren't huge but adequate for the amount of time spent in the room! Big flat screen TV in the room and 2 very comfy pillows each - I hate places that only give one pillow!!! The WI-FI always had a strong connection - usefull for me skyping home!! There are no full length mirrors and no safe which I expected, but no major complaints! No resturant or bar in the hotel although you could order room service and there is a lovely cafe next door!
reviews.title: Very trendy and great value for location

reviews.text: Tea and coffee is served every morning and there is a wine tasting session every afternoon 5-6! Fantastic when you've spent all day walking around!!
reviews.title: A gem in a big city.

reviews.text: Clean, quite,entrance to china town, walk to great resturants.... City sight seeing(hop on hop off bus) right out side entrance. If you want a great getaway, try this small lobby friendly hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent service,great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was wonderful, friendly, and helpful; rooms were fun and comfortable; just a great place to stay. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco!
reviews.title: Perfect hotel in a perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Over the years I've stayed in a few but I none I have liked more than this one. A terrific location just outside the gates of China Town and next to the financial district. Short walk to the Bart if you are coming in via SFO.
reviews.title: May be my Favorite S.F. Hotel

reviews.text: Very friendly staff, nice comfortable compact rooms. I really liked the funky decor and sense of humor that the property displayed. Could have used some sort of dresser for clothing but other than that no complaints.
reviews.title: Strategic and Comfortable

reviews.text: Love the hotel here. The staffs are amazing. I feel so much at home, thanks to their quality service. Room is very clean and comfortable... my only disappointment is just the malfunctioned hair dryer in the toilet. But other than that, I have no complaints at all. Strategically placed in Union Square... and opposite the entrance of Chinatown, Hotel Triton is definitely a place I will stay again next time.
reviews.title: Loved it!!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Triton with 3 other girls for a dental convention from September 26-30. Our hotel was booked through the ADA but I picked it out because I thought it looked like fun. From the second we got there to the second we left we were treated like old friends. Remember the old saying, treat others the way you would like to be treated. If you walk into any hotel with an attitude or a chip on your shoulder you're probably going to get the same in return... and ya know what? Ya probably deserve it. Anything we needed they were right on it. They made dinner reservations for us on a few occasions and if we needed anything else they took care of it immediately. I didn't seem to need anything though. There wasn't a thing wrong with the room, the beds were comfortable, and the room was clean. Anyone that complains about the room size is just being a pain in the rear. you think that's small? Go to Europe! If you want a bigger room go stay at a $400 a night hotel! Who cares! I'm not 500 pounds so I had a fine time getting around with my roommate and I don't plan to be in the room but to sleep anyway so that shouldn't even matter. I loved the fresh cookies and wine offered. All free. I also thought the complimentary massages and tarot card readings were cool. It's dog friendly which is nice for those who need it. But I didn't see one trace of any animals the whole time I was there. It's located in a great area, right across the street from China Town. And for those who complain about the noise, get over it! IT'S A CITY PEOPLE!, there is going to be street noise. I slept like a baby. You think thats bad... go to New York!! If you want 100% absolute quite go stay in a bed and breakfast in the mountains of Montana! Gee, some of these other reviews really errked me! At any rate, this is a great hotel, there is a fantastic pub around the corner called the Irish Bank, ask for Mark, tell him Alicia sent ya. I can't wait to go back and I am definatly staying at the Triton! Oh and just a note for you single girls out there..... there is no place on earth better to meet single STRAIGHT men! :)
reviews.title: can't wait to come back!!!

likes.disliked: — Not a thing, this place was great!!!

description: The Hotel Triton is a creative vision made real. Sprung from the imaginations of San Francisco artists, the Hotel Triton is a colorful and ever-current showcase of the pop culture that keeps this city vibrant. It is a welcoming wonderland that cares for you as if you were the Greek god for which the hotel is named. Across from the Chinatown gates, the Hotel Triton is conveniently located near San Francisco's top destinations and attractions.
